intro: Zephyranthes mesochloa f. flavescens, commonly known as the golden rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are often bluish-green in color. The species is noted for its ability to bloom during the summer months, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
